content: I pay attention to the story structure. I also ask myself what works for me and what doesn’t . . . and why. So, for instance, I just watched the first season of BBC’s Home Fires and totally loved it. I loved the way that it’s a layered story — the story of middle aged women in the middle of the last century and how they live and how they get along together. But it’s also about war and how men in that time responded to war. Conversely, I’ve tried to watch Supernatural about a dozen times and I can’t get through the first season. Why not? I like each individual episode — so why do I keep losing the thread of the show? It’s because the episodes are SO self-contained that when one’s done, it’s super easy to just stop. There isn’t anything pulling me through to the next episode. No over arching story arch.
